Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
So I guess it comes down to this here, do we as the marketing team, reach out to MN communities in order to spend our time and efforts to convince them to change their coin design (potentially losing their adopters) because we don't support MN and want more projects to migrate?

Do we reach out to them and offer half baked services and see if they want to spend their own effort to design the MN system that works with KMD AC?

Do we ignore these communities and focus only on those coins that are consistent with the AC structures we can provide?

Real question btw.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Notice I didn't say should we add MN capabilities in house, seeing as that doesn't appear to be something we want to work on.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: which isn't a problem, just trying to get marketing/migration focused in on

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
I can't see any way where I'd consider any solution Komodo has to offer as "half baked"; however, the reality is that dev only goes so far so fast. *Someone* has to dev  anything to be added.
The real question is:
Do you want to over-burden dev just to have a "good marketing plan/campaign" for those that currently have a differing structure than Komodo offers?

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Perhaps that was the wrong word choice? I didn't mean it insultingly, just in that we can offer blockchain services, but if we are offering them to a specific group (MN communities) and we don't offer the MN parts...

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
So it comes down to how do we engage with MN communities about migration, or don't we?

@Gordon Komodo what do you think?
